scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This architectural drawing (fragment)of the ground floor of "Farmington," Albemarle County, Virginia, is possibly a study produced by Robert Mills (1781-1855) late in his career. Mills studied architecture under Thomas Jefferson, who designed the additions to the original residence (built by Francis Jerdone in 1760) for his friend George Divers, in 1802. The paper bears the following watermark of "J. Whatman Turkey Mill 1855," a type of paper known to have been used extensively by Mills.
